data.text:
Exciting news for testing enthusiasts! David Janota, our Global Head of Digital Assurance, will be taking the stage as a speaker at the upcoming TestCrunch Conference in Brno. If you are curious about AI and machine learning and wondering how neural networks revolutionize software testing, join David on March 27th as he discusses "Under the Hood of Neural Networks" (CZ). Discover the positive effects of neural networks on the testing process and prepare for revolutionary insights from our speaker. Don't miss out on this exciting session! Secure your spot now: https://lnkd.in/ex7nAdzV See you at TestCrunch 2024! #ciklum #conference #ai #machinelearning

HOT OFF THE PRESS‚ÄºÔ∏è EU lawmakers have reached a political agreement on the AI Act rather unexpectedly given the political drama of these past days and doubts as to whether the AI Act would get adopted before the EU Parliament elections next summer. Finally, the political will to be the first region in the world to implement a comprehensive AI legislation pushed the co-legislators to reach an agreement. üïó The text still needs to be formally adopted and may only come into full application in 2025. Nonetheless, the impact of the AI Act on developers, deployers and distributors of AI systems in the EU will be huge given the extra territorial scope of the law. ‚úèÔ∏è Key provisions: ‚úÖ Safeguards agreed on general purpose artificial intelligence ‚úÖ Limitation for the use of biometric identification systems by law enforcement ‚úÖ Bans on social scoring and AI used to manipulate or exploit user vulnerabilities ‚úÖ Right of consumers to launch complaints and receive meaningful explanations ‚úÖ Fines ranging from 35 million euro or 7% of global turnover to 7.5 million or 1.5% of turnover https://lnkd.in/guxTxEbf Fieldfisher Belgium Olivier Proust Tim Van Canneyt Nathalie Poupaert Louis Vanderdonckt In√®s Benazzouz Eliot Sanam Ilung Naomi Capelle #artificialintelligence #aiact #tech #fieldfisher
